- Faster TUI navigation between screens
- Reduced Splunk server load
- Better offline experience with stale-while-revalidate

tasks.title: Add undo/redo system for destructive TUI operations
tasks.description:

- Delete lookup

tasks.title: Add circuit breaker pattern for resilient API calls
tasks.description:
Implement circuit breaker pattern to prevent cascading failures when Splunk API is struggling. Current retry logic retries forever without considering overall system health.

Circuit breaker states:
- Closed: Normal operation, requests pass through
- Open: Failure threshold exceeded, requests fail fast
- Half-Open: Testing if service recovered

Configuration per endpoint:
- failure_threshold: 5 errors in 60s to open
- reset_timeout: 30s before half-open test
- half_open_requests: 1 test request allowed

Benefits:
- Fast fail during outages (better UX than hanging)
- Prevents overwhelming struggling Splunk instances
- Automatic recovery detection
- Metrics for circuit state changes

Implementation wraps the client with circuit breaker middleware using failsafe or custom implementation.
evidence: Retry logic exists but retries forever without circuit breaking (crates/client/src/endpoints/request.rs:174-421)
No failure threshold or backoff between batches of requests
All requests continue to failing endpoint during outages
No metrics for tracking endpoint health over time
plan: Create circuit_breaker.rs with CircuitBreaker and CircuitState enums
Implement failure tracking with sliding window per endpoint
Add circuit breaker middleware to HTTP client
Emit metrics for circuit state transitions
Add TUI indicator showing circuit state for current profile
Add --circuit-breaker flag to CLI for enable/disable
Write chaos tests simulating endpoint failures
Verify by simulating 5 failures and seeing circuit open with fast-fail

tasks.title: Add transaction support for multi-step configuration changes
tasks.description:
Implement transaction support for atomic multi-step configuration operations. Currently multi-step operations lack atomicity - partial failures can leave system in inconsistent state.

Transaction features:
- Begin/commit/rollback for configuration changes
- Savepoint support for nested operations
- Automatic rollback on error
- Preview/dry-run mode showing planned changes
- Transaction log for audit trail

Use cases:
- Create index + setup inputs + configure forwarding (all succeed or all rollback)
- Modify multiple saved searches atomically
- Bulk user/role changes with consistency

Implementation uses two-phase commit pattern:
1. Phase 1: Validate all operations, acquire locks
2. Phase 2: Execute operations, commit or rollback

Benefits: Data consistency, auditability, safer bulk operations.
evidence: No transaction support in client or CLI - operations are individual API calls
Multi-step config changes can fail partially leaving inconsistent state
No rollback mechanism for failed operations
